Jacob's Blog

This blog will delve into the multifaceted aspects of an average middle school student who goes to an international school. You will be able to track his coding journey that will eventually manifest into a business venture.

My Social Life


Family

My family is a tapestry of rich connections and diverse relationships. I am fortunate to have four loving grandparents, five aunts, four uncles, and two cousins. Within my immediate family, I share a special bond with my twin brother and am supported by my two caring parents.

Friends

My school life is marked by the friendships I have cultivated over the years at two distinct international schools. For seven years, I attended the Yongsan International School of Seoul (YISS) in Seoul, where I built enduring relationships. Additionally, I have developed meaningful connections at the Seoul International School (SIS) in Gyeonggi-do.

Clubs and Activities

To enrich my social experience, I have actively participated in various clubs and activities:
  • Student Council: I contribute to the governance and organization of school events.
  • Volunteering Work: I engage in community service by helping at school events, including yearly cultural events and assemblies.
  • Team Sports: I am an enthusiastic participant in volleyball and basketball.
  • National Academic Quiz Tournament: I am a committed member of the team, expressing my passion for knowledge.
